greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = (number of nonprimes <= n) - (number of primes <= n).
formula: a(n) = n - 2*pi(n) =  n - 2*A000720(n). - _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Jun 16 2013
a(n) - a(n-1) = 1 - 2*A010051(n) for n > 1. - _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Dec 18 2018
example: a(7) = -1 because there are 3 nonprimes <= 7 (1,4 and 6) and 4 primes <= 7 (2,3,5 and 7).
mathematica: Accumulate[ -1 + 2 * Boole /@ Not /@ PrimeQ @ Range @ 100] (* _Federico Provvedi_, Oct 06 2013 *)
program: \\ The number of composite numbers less than or equal to n
composites(n) = { my(c,x); c=0; for(x=1,n, if(!isprime(x),c++); ); return(c) }
results.author: _Cino Hilliard_, Aug 23 2004
